Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring all schools to stock airway clearance devices, and to repeal section two of such local law upon the expiration thereof
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring all schools to stock airway clearance devices, and to repeal section two of such local law upon the expiration thereof.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York City Department of Education and the New York State Education Department to collaborate on and prioritize increasing the number of educators trained to work with English Language Learners and to improve the quality and comprehensiveness of English Language Learners’ education.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: DOE and the NYS Education Dept to collaborate on and prioritize increasing the number of educators trained to work with English Language Learners and to improve the quality and comprehensiveness of English Language Learners’ education.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Education Department to allow a lifeguard certification to substitute for Physical Education Credit for high school seniors aged 17 years and older.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Allow a lifeguard certification to substitute for Physical Education Credit for high school seniors aged 17 years and older.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring all schools to stock airway clearance devices, and to repeal section two of such local law upon the expiration thereof

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring all schools to stock airway clearance devices, and to repeal section two of such local law upon the expiration thereof
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
